Produce a violin plot

Source: R/plotting.R
INTERNAL_violin_plot.Rd

Generate (but not evaluate) the commands required to produce a vertical or horizontal violin plot.

.violin_plot(plot_data, param_choices, x_lab, y_lab, color_lab, shape_lab,
  title, horizontal = FALSE, by_row = FALSE, is_subsetted = FALSE,
  is_downsampled = FALSE)

.violin_setup(plot_data, horizontal = FALSE)

Arguments

plot_data

A data.frame containing all of the plotting information, returned by .extract_plotting_data in envir$plot.data.
param_choices

A single-row DataFrame that contains all the input settings for the current panel.
x_lab

A character label for the X axis. Set to NULL to have no x-axis label.
y_lab

A character label for the Y axis. Set to NULL to have no y-axis label.
color_lab

A character label for the color scale. Set to NULL to have no color label.
shape_lab

A character label for the color scale. Set to NULL to have no shape label.
title

A character title for the plot. Set to NULL to have no title.
horizontal

A logical value that indicates whether violins should be drawn horizontally (i.e., Y axis categorical and X axis continuous).
by_row

A logical scalar specifying whether the plot deals with row-level metadata.
is_subsetted

A logical scalar specifying whether plot_data was subsetted during .process_selectby_choice.
is_downsampled

A logical scalar specifying whether plot_data was downsampled in .plot_wrapper.

Value

For .violin_setup, a character vector of commands to be parsed and evaluated by .extract_plotting_data to set up the required fields.

For .violin_plot, a character vector of commands to be parsed and evaluated by .create_plot to produce the violin plot.

Details

Any commands to modify plot.data in preparation for creating a violin plot should be placed in .violin_setup, to be called by .extract_plotting_data. This includes swapping of X and Y variables when horizontal=TRUE, and adding of horizontal/vertical jitter to points.

As described in ?.create_plot, the .violin_plot function should only contain commands to generate the final ggplot object.

plot.data.all will be used to define the y-axis boundaries (or x-axis boundaries when horizontal=TRUE). This ensures consistent plot boundaries when selecting points to restrict (see ?.process_selectby_choice), or when downsampling for speed (see ?.create_plot.

Similarly, envir$plot.data.pre will be used to create the violins (see .create_plot). This ensures consistent violins when downsampling for speed - otherwise the violins will be computed from the downsampled set of points.

See also

.extract_plotting_data, .create_plot

Contents

  • Value
